term.title: flash fluorimetry

item.text: The term used when decay times luminescence are measured using a pulsed source of radiation. It is often necessary to separate the signal due to the light flash from luminescence emission signal by a deconvolution technique in order to obtain the correct decay curve for emission. Decay times corrected for this effect are termed corrected decay times of fluorescence or phosphorescence.
